This is part true. They made every Muslim convert to Christianity or leave in 1492 but many only did it for appearance. Most were still Muslim. In 1536 Philip II tried to make these conversos leave all their customs behind like speaking Arabic and this prompted the revolt in Granada in 1537. Only in 1609 did Philip III finally kick all the Muslims out of the country

Combined with all the other contextual reasons people have said (war with the Dutch) the Kings that followed Philip II were all pretty bad.
Phillip II would micro manage everything and immersed himself in state affairs. His son and grandson cared way more about leisure activities and left the job of governing to their court favourites and this helped bankrupt the country. Whether it was Portugal leaving the Union or the Catalans revolting all took their toll. The other powers circled round taking territory they're always desired-France did this the most. Philip's great grandson was mentally handicapped and could have children his reign was even worse. He died without an heir and the other powers moved in to put someone they wanted on the thrown.
The Spanish empire never recovers from this
And all of the other people cut out like Martin Sheen etc loads of famous people had roles cut out

WRITING.TEXT: I know a lot of people hate him but I feel this and The Thin Red Line are two of his best. For me the way the New World has been filmed really adds to the feeling we are seeing what it was really like. The bleakness of it at times really made me realise just how shitty it would be to live in this era. Beautiful soundtrack by James Horner, great visuals and good performances from Farrell and Bale. Movie that will stick with you, especially if you love to visualise old time periods.

So at the time as most of allies saw it, they were dropped to bring a quick end to the war. The Japanese were not big on surrender and would have mostly fought to the death in a mainland invasion of Japan. Allied casualties would be extremely high and since they had the technology why would they waste the lives of their own troops.
As time has gone on it has become more cynical. Revenge for Pearl Harbour is one factor but not the biggest. A massive one was keeping the USSR out of Japan, as they had already taken over the North of Korea and they were currently doing battle with the Japanese in Mongolia. Allowing the war to continue might mean Japan being split into.
Now the most cynical aspect is the racial element. Many have now argued that the US constantly demonised the common 'Jap' as no better than an animal. Many have thought the nuke would have never been used on Germany if the roles were reversed because they were white and had a shared history with the US.
Overall I think many of these factors play a role but I believe that ending the war quickly and not having to lose more US life is the main reason.

WRITING.TITLE: Does anyone get annoyed that legitimate criticism of Islam has been destroyed by 'Islamophobia' !?
WRITING.TEXT:
So I am in the planning phases of my podcast where I am going to harshly criticise each religion. I've studied Islam a lot at Uni and there are so many things that get lost in the racist stereotype of Muslims sweeping western country. Muslims are basically hated for the colour of their skin and the association with terrorism but rarely do we see a intellectual criticism of Islam without the people doing it being called 'racist'.
Where in the mainstream media or even alternative media do we hear a lot of people say Muhammad was a conquering warlord who killed and enslaved many? Where do people say he knew Jewish and Christian merchants so it's no surprise Angel Gabriel (same one who visited Mary what a coincidence!) visited Muhammad. If you delve into it, it's so clear Muhammad just copied abrahamic religion and added himself to further is own power-but again we don't hear this often. (Much easier to get followers when you take what they know and add yourself as the newest chapter-right Jesus?)
It's all well and good to criticise Christianity (and people do it all the time easily) but does anyone else find it so frustrating that people are afraid to criticise Islam in the same way out of fear of being labelled a racist/bigot?
All religion is bullshit but I just wished we would criticise each as harshly as the other but in an intellectual way.
